case_vignette: A 70-year-old male visits his primary care physician because of progressive weight loss. He has a 20-year history of smoking 2 packs of cigarettes a day and was diagnosed with diabetes mellitus 6 years ago. After physical examination, the physician tells the patient he suspects adenocarcinoma at the head of the pancreas. Which of the following physical examination findings would support the diagnosis:
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing progressive weight loss.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, fatigue, or difficulty swallowing?
No, I haven't noticed symptoms like fever or difficulty swallowing, but I have been feeling more tired than usual.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or eating habits?
Yes, my appetite has decreased recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or body composition?
Yes, I've been losing weight without trying.
Have you had any recent changes in your medical history or medications?
I was diagnosed with diabetes 6 years ago.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history of medical conditions?
I'm just a patient, so I don't have that information to share.
Final Diagnosis: Anorexia nervosa.

trial_0.vignette_frq: Physical examination findings that would support the diagnosis of adenocarcinoma at the head of the pancreas include a palpable mass in the epigastric region, tenderness in the abdomen, and a history of smoking and diabetes mellitus. The final diagnosis is adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.
